qas.question: In what year did Philip pass away?
Who was next in line to the throne at the time of Philip's death?
In what year were did the Macedonians lose The Battle of Pydna?
How did Rome respond to their successive losses against the Macedonians?
Who had initially begun the Third Macedonian War?

context: In <a0_0>179 BC<a0_0/> Philip died. His talented and ambitious son, <a1_0>Perseus<a1_0/>, took the throne and showed a renewed interest in conquering Greece. With her Greek allies facing a major new threat, <a4_0>Rome<a4_0/> declared war on Macedonia again, starting the Third Macedonian War. Perseus initially had some success against the Romans. However, Rome responded <a3_0>by sending a stronger army<a3_0/>. This second consular army decisively defeated the Macedonians at the Battle of Pydna in <a2_0>168 BC<a2_0/> and the Macedonians duly capitulated, ending the war.
